pr_title: [WIP] HIVE-24543: Support SAML 2.0 as an authentication mechanism

timeline.message: Added additional configuration. SAML redirect happens when token is not present and port is present
revert back the surefire plugin version change

timeline.bodyText: nit: SAML2 should be SAML to match the value in the set
timeline.author: nrg4878
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -3871,15 +3870,16 @@ private static void populateLlapDaemonVarsSet(Set<String> llapDaemonVarsSetLocal
 
     // HiveServer2 auth configuration
     HIVE_SERVER2_AUTHENTICATION("hive.server2.authentication", "NONE",
-      new StringSet("NOSASL", "NONE", "LDAP", "KERBEROS", "PAM", "CUSTOM"),
+      new StringSet("NOSASL", "NONE", "LDAP", "KERBEROS", "PAM", "CUSTOM", "SAML"),
         "Client authentication types.\n" +
         "  NONE: no authentication check\n" +
         "  LDAP: LDAP/AD based authentication\n" +
         "  KERBEROS: Kerberos/GSSAPI authentication\n" +
         "  CUSTOM: Custom authentication provider\n" +
         "          (Use with property hive.server2.custom.authentication.class)\n" +
         "  PAM: Pluggable authentication module\n" +
-        "  NOSASL:  Raw transport"),
+        "  NOSASL:  Raw transport\n" +
+        "  SAML2: SAML 2.0 compliant authentication. This is only supported in http transport mode."),

timeline.author: nrg4878

timeline.bodyText: I understand why this is done but feels odd that this throws a SQLException. Can we throw something else here and then wrap it in a SQLException in the calling method? Even a TTransportException would make sense over SQLException (though it is not thrown from thrift).
timeline.author: nrg4878

replies.bodyText: I updated the code to throw a new SQLException(new IllegalArgumentException()) here. However, I don't see what is the real benefit of doing this way since the constructor of HiveConnection only allows for SQLException to be thrown.
replies.author: vihangk1

timeline.bodyText: wouldn't httpClientBuilder be null if cookieAuth is disabled? We could use http transport with cookieAuth disabled right?
timeline.author: nrg4878

replies.bodyText: I am not sure if you are reviewing this one commit at a time or by combining all the commits. line 626 on the latest code in this branch creates a httpClientBuilder if the cookieAuth is disabled.
replies.author: vihangk1

replies.bodyText: This is however a good point. Having browser mode without cookie auth doesn't make sense. Since without cookie auth, each http call will open a browser (althought it will be automatically authenticated). I think for the first version may be we should disallow browser auth if cookie-auth is not enabled on the server side. Thoughts?
replies.author: vihangk1

timeline.bodyText: TODO: If nothing to do, should we remove your name from the comment?
timeline.author: nrg4878

replies.bodyText: yeah, sorry. I removed my name. I had it to track all the todos.
replies.author: vihangk1

timeline.bodyText: is this a known error code for failed auth?
timeline.author: nrg4878

replies.bodyText: I could find where to look for these standard error codes. The closest hit online was the https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/odbc/reference/appendixes/appendix-a-odbc-error-codes?view=sql-server-ver15 which lists 08S01 as "communications like failure". I didn't see anything which suggests a authentication error. The closest was perhaps 28000 but I am not sure if this is the right place to look for these codes. Do you know where can I find this for JDBC?
replies.author: vihangk1

timeline.bodyText: is 08S01 a known error code for failed auth with SAML?
timeline.author: nrg4878

replies.bodyText: 08S01 stands for "communications link failure" which is not exactly what we want but arguably related to the authentication error. I can interpret it as "User is not authenticated and hence communications link failed". I would be happy to update this to a more specific error code if you know of a better one.
replies.author: vihangk1

timeline.bodyText: its not clear what the change is here. The proposed code looks similar to the existing code in the OpenSession() method. What has changed?
timeline.author: nrg4878

replies.bodyText: The patch moves these lines (900-926) before the patch into a separate method so that we can have a retry attempt of this code. The first attempt to get the redirect URL and the second one to actually open the session.
replies.author: vihangk1

timeline.bodyText: @vihangk1 Could you please add some comments to the method as to why we look for 302 and 303 in the error message. This will help remember the logic
timeline.author: nrg4878

timeline.bodyText: should this account for serverSocket being null in case of an exception in getServerSocket() ?
timeline.author: nrg4878

replies.bodyText: serverSocket is a final field and it will always be not-null. If there is an exception during getServerSocket, the HiveJdbcBrowserClient's constructor will error out.
replies.author: vihangk1

timeline.bodyText: looks like this needs some real validation code?
timeline.author: nrg4878

replies.bodyText: Initially I thought we can add a validation check to confirm that the SSO URL is from an expected domain. However, I plan to move that to a separate task since it is not critical. I removed this from the patch.

not sure I understand how this works.

timeline.message: HIVE-24543: Support SAML 2.0 as an authentication mechanism

revert back the surefire plugin version change
modified preconditions check to allow callback URLs without any port
Added a connection parameter to optionally disable SSL enforcement
reduced dependencies and fixed redirect code path
Add a check for support for Browse action
Fix for download artifact error for shibboleth dependencies
